SEARCH
Package com.smarthome

Class PriorityQueue<T>

java.lang.Object
com.smarthome.PriorityQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the task associated with each priority.
public class PriorityQueue<T> extends Object
A generic priority queue implementation using an ArrayList. Elements are ordered based on their priority, with lower priority values indicating higher priority.

  • Method Details

    • enqueue

      public void enqueue(Task<T> newTask)
      Adds a new task to the priority queue, maintaining the priority order.
      Parameters:
      newTask - The task to be added to the queue.

    • dequeue

      public void dequeue()
      Removes the highest priority task from the queue (the task at the front of the queue).

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the priority and task of each element in the queue to the console.

    • peek

      public Task<T> peek()
      Returns the highest priority task in the queue without removing it.
      Returns:
      The highest priority task, or null if the queue is empty.

    • getQueue

      public ArrayList<Task<T>> getQueue()
      Returns a new ArrayList containing all the tasks currently in the priority queue.
      Returns:
      A new ArrayList containing all the tasks in the queue.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of tasks currently in the priority queue.
      Returns:
      The size of the queue.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the priority queue is empty.
      Returns:
      True if the queue contains no tasks, false otherwise.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all tasks from the priority queue, making it empty.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Task<T> task)
      Checks if the priority queue contains a specific task.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to search for.
      Returns:
      True if the queue contains the specified task, false otherwise.

    • updatePriority

      public void updatePriority(Task<T> task, int priority)
      Updates the priority of an existing task in the queue.
      Parameters:
      task - The task whose priority needs to be updated.
      priority - The new priority for the task.

    • getPriority

      public int getPriority(T task)
      Retrieves the priority of a task in the queue based on its task content.
      Parameters:
      task - The task content to search for.
      Returns:
      The priority of the task if found, or -1 if the task is not in the queue.

    • getTask

      public Task<T> getTask(int priority)
      Retrieves the first task in the queue with the specified priority.
      Parameters:
      priority - The priority to search for.
      Returns:
      The first task with the specified priority, or null if no task with that priority exists.
